page.title: 04Ornithology (cont.)
page.content: We noticed three main differences. Firstly,some of the names used in 1900 were localised names which are not in use today - Wild duck for Mallard, Willow Wren for Willow Warbler and Land rail for Corn crake,(also no mention of Marsh tits).Secondly,since 1900 some species are no longer present in the area,Merlin, Hobby, Landrail and Wryneck in particular. Finally,we noted some species which are today present but were not mentioned in 1900.Collared Dove,Little Owl and Marsh Tit are examples of this final category. To discover the variety of species that may be discovered on a walk through the block we decided to spend a morning exploring the region,and noting down all the species recorded.We split into two groups, and
